Title: Bullet Train
Actors: Brad Pitt, Joey King, Aaron Taylor-Johnson
Plot: Trained killer Ladybug wants to give up the life but is pulled back in by his handler Maria Beetle in order to collect a briefcase on a bullet train heading from Tokyo to Morioka. On board are fellow assasins Kimura, the Prince, Tangerine, and Lemon. Once on board the five assasins discover that their objectives are all connected.
Subtitle: Azerbaijani

Title: Jumanji
Writer: Jonathan Hensleigh, Greg Taylor, Jim Strain
Actors: Robin Williams, Kirsten Dunst, Bonnie Hunt
Plot: Jumanji, one of the most unique--and dangerous--board games ever, falls into the hands of the curious teen, Alan Parrish, in 1969. Mysterious and magical, the game strands the unsuspecting boy in the lush, savage forests of a mythical realm. Nearly three decades later, the game releases him before the awed eyes of the young orphaned siblings, Judy and Peter Shepherd. Now, the wild and incessant beat of the jungle's tribal drums is calling for the now-adult Alan and the other hesitant players, as the one who rolls the dice must never leave undone what the roll has started. Has anyone ever escaped from the game and Jumanji's formidable foes?
Subtitle: Azerbaijani

Title: Pattie And The Wrath of Poseidon
Director: David Alo, Eric Tosti, Jean-Francois Tosti
Actors: Casey Chase, Christophe Lemoine, Emmanuel Curtil
Plot: Brave mouse Patty lives in the heart of ancient Greece, where absolutely everything is possible. Admiring local heroes and heavenly gods, she desperately dreams of a great adventure. However, her best friend, the big and very anxious cat Sam, goes out of his way to protect her from any danger. But when Poseidon threatens to destroy their town, Patty and Sam are forced to embark on an exciting journey full of incredible places and bizarre creatures straight out of myth.
Subtitle: Azerbaijani

Title: Day Shift
Actors: Jamie Foxx, Dave Franco, Natasha Liu Bordizzo
Plot: A hard-working, blue-collar dad just wants to provide a good life for his quick-witted 10-year-old daughter. His mundane San Fernando Valley pool cleaning job is a front for his real source of income: hunting and killing vampires.

Title: Intern
Plot: Seventy-year-old widower Ben Whittaker, a retired executive from DEX One, applies to fill the newly conceived position of senior intern, after retirement has become too boring for him. He applies to About The Fit, a fast-growing e-commerce fashion startup in Brooklyn. Founder and CEO Jules Ostin had previously agreed to a community outreach program where seniors would intern at the firm. Ben impresses everyone and is one of four hired.
Subtitle: Azerbaijani

Title: Interstellar
Actors: Evan Peters, Richard Jenkins, Molly Ringwald

Writer: Nikolaj Coster-Waldau, Joe Derrick, Ejnar Mikkelsen
Actors: Adam Driver, Ariana Greenblatt, Chloe Coleman
Plot: After a crash on an unknown planet, pilot Mills quickly discovers that he's actually stuck on Earth... 65 million years ago. Now, with only one chance to escape, Mills and the last surviving Koa must make their way through an unknown area infested with dangerous creatures.

Title: Saw
Writer: Adam Berg, Pelle Rådström, Surbhi Sehgal
Actors: Noomi Rapace, Jakob Oftebro, Dar Salim
Plot: A photographer named Adam awakens in a dilapidated bathtub, with his ankle chained to a pipe. Across the room is oncologist Dr. Lawrence Gordon, also chained. Between them is the corpse of an apparent suicide victim holding a revolver and a microcassette recorder. Both men find a tape in their pockets, and Adam retrieves the recorder. Adam's tape urges him to survive, while Gordon's tells him to kill Adam by six o'clock or his wife Alison and daughter Diana will be killed. Adam finds a bag containing two hacksaws inside the toilet. Both men try to saw through their chains, but Adam's saw breaks. Subtitle: Azerbaijani

Title: Three Thousand Years of Longing
Writer: George Miller, Augusta Gore, A.S. Byatt
Actors: Tilda Swinton, Idris Elba, Pia Thunderbolt
Plot: A lonely scholar, on a trip to Istanbul, discovers a Djinn who offers her three wishes in exchange for his freedom.

Title: Legend
Actors: Tom Hardy, Emily Browning, Taron Egerton
Plot: The true story of London's most notorious gangsters, twins Reggie and Ronnie Kray. As the brothers rise through the criminal underworld, Ronnie advances the family business with violence and intimidation while Reggie struggles to go legitimate for local girl Frances Shea. In and out of prison, Ronnie's unpredictable tendencies and the slow disintegration of Reggie's marriage threaten to bring the brothers' empire tumbling to the ground.
Subtitle: Azerbaijani

Title: What Will Happen To Me
Actors: Emre Altukh, Algi Eke, Yaman Tumen
Plot: Halim Pekyaman, whom the family considered disobedient as a child, does not like children. He spends his days living the life of a playboy. Once everything turns upside down when he talks about children live. Declared an enemy of children, he is kicked out of the TV channel, and he runs away to a country house in Kusadasi. His path crosses with Melek, who was abandoned by her husband and who is fighting for her life with her four children. Halim, in love with Melek, is ironically forced to look after her children. Will he be able to forget his luxurious life in Istanbul and become the head of the family?
Awards: Nominated for 1 Primetime Emmy. 4 wins & 16 nominations total
Subtitle: Azerbaijani
